sources.title: The Valachi Papers (1972) From Mobster to Informant: Charles Bronson Exposes the Mafia
sources.description:
Gangster Joe Valachi is a marked man in the same joint where mob boss Don Vito Genovese is imprisoned and he's forced to co-operate with the DA in exchange for protection.

Original title: The Valachi Papers
Director: Terence Young
Writers: Stephen Geller (screenplay), Peter Maas (book)

Main cast:
Charles Bronson – Joseph Valachi
Lino Ventura – Don Vito Genovese
Jill Ireland – Maria Reina Valachi
Walter Chiari – Dominick "The Gap" Petrilli
Joseph Wiseman – Salvatore Maranzano

Genres: Crime, Drama, Historical
Release date: November 1972
Filming locations: New York City, USA; Rome, Italy


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: When Joe Valachi (Charles Bronson) has a price put on his head by Don Vito Genovese (Lino Ventura), he must take desperate steps to protect himself while in prison. An unsuccessful attempt to slit his throat puts him over the edge to break the sacred code of silence.
metadata.Writer: Stephen Geller, Peter Maas, Massimo De Rita
metadata.Actors: Charles Bronson, Lino Ventura, Jill Ireland
